dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 2337 RS: Lake Hill Administrative Site Affordable Housing Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
Reported by Ms. Landrieu, without amendment

form.official-title: To provide for the conveyance of the Forest Service Lake Hill Administrative Site in Summit County, Colorado.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lake Hill Administrative Site Affordable Housing Act.

paragraph.text: The term County means Summit County, Colorado.

The term Lake Hill Administrative Site means the parcel of approximately 40 acres of National Forest System land in the County, as depicted on the map entitled Lake Hill Administrative Site and dated June 2012.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Agriculture.

section.header: Conveyance of Forest Service Lake Hill Administrative Site, Summit County, Colorado

subsection.text: Upon receipt of an offer from the County in which the County agrees to the condition imposed by subsection (c), the Secretary shall use the authority provided by the Forest Service Facility Realignment and Enhancement Act of 2005 (Public Law 109–54; 16 U.S.C. 580d note) to convey to the County all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the Forest Service Lake Hill Administrative Site.

paragraph.text: The Lake Hill Administrative Site is considered to be an administrative site under section 502(1)(A) of the Forest Service Facility Realignment and Enhancement Act of 2005 (Public Law 109–54; 16 U.S.C. 580d note).
Section 502(1)(C) of that Act does not apply to the conveyance of the Lake Hill Administrative Site.

subsection.text: The County shall be responsible for processing and transaction costs related to the direct sale under subsection (a).

Proceeds received from the conveyance pursuant to subsection (a) shall be available, without further appropriation and until expended, for capital improvement and maintenance of Forest Service facilities in Region 2 of the United States Forest Service.
